statement:
Given a domain $U\subset\mathbb{C}$, $a\in U$, and
$f:U\setminus\{a\}\to\mathbb{C}$ being holomorphic, then $a$ is an
essential singularity of $f$ if and only if the image of any punctured
neighborhood of $a$ under $f$ is dense in $\mathbb{C}$. Put another way,
a holomorphic function can come in an arbitrarily small neighborhood of
its essential singularity arbitrarily close to any complex value.
